messages.content: Don't make assumptions about what values to plug into functions. Ask for clarification if a user request is ambiguous.

It looks like location services on your device are currently turned off, so I can’t fetch your coordinates. To determine where you are, I can either:

1. Help you turn on location services (so I can read your GPS position automatically), or  
2. You can share your current latitude and longitude with me.

Which would you prefer?

messages.name: set_location_service_status
messages.content: PermissionError: Location service cannot be turned on in low battery mode

Your device is currently in Low Power Mode, which is preventing me from enabling Location Services. Would you like me to turn off Low Power Mode so I can then turn on Location Services? Alternatively, you can provide your latitude and longitude manually.
Please turn off Low Power Mode for me.
Location Services are now enabled. Please let me know your current latitude and longitude, and I’ll look up your exact address.
I'm not sure what they are.

No problem—here’s how you can find your device’s latitude and longitude:

1. On iPhone (iOS 14+):
   • Open the Maps app.  
   • Tap the location-arrow icon at bottom-left to center on your spot.  
   • Press and hold the blue dot marking your location until a context card pops up.  
   • Your latitude and longitude will be shown near the bottom—tap it to copy.

2. On Android (Google Maps):
   • Open the Google Maps app.  
   • Tap the location-target icon (bottom-right) to center on your spot.  
   • Touch and hold the blue dot marking your location.  
   • A pin will drop and the coordinates appear in the search bar at the top—tap to copy.

Once you have those two numbers (e.g. 37.4219, -122.0840), just paste them here and I’ll look up your exact address. Let me know if you need any more help!
Alright, let me check and get back to you!
Sounds good! Just drop your latitude and longitude here when you have them, and I’ll find your address.
Great—whenever you have your latitude and longitude, just send them over and I’ll look up your address right away.
